results.ground_truth: When engine cranks but won't start, check these in order of likelihood: (1) Fuel system - verify fuel level and pump operation, test fuel pressure at 40-50 PSI [Citation: Para 1-2.1, Table 1-1]. (2) Ignition system - test for spark at plugs [Citation: Para 1-2.3]. (3) Air intake - inspect for severe restrictions [Citation: Para 1-2]. WARNING: Fuel system under pressure, wear eye protection [Safety Notice 1-A].

results.ground_truth: Engine overheating (gauge above 220°F) has several probable causes: (1) Low coolant level - 50% probability, check reservoir when cold [Citation: Para 2-2.1]. (2) Thermostat failure - 25% probability, test if upper hose gets hot at 195°F [Citation: Para 2-2.2]. (3) Water pump failure - 15% probability, inspect for leaks and bearing noise [Citation: Para 2-2.3]. (4) Radiator blockage - 10% probability. WARNING: Never open cooling system when hot, wait 30 minutes minimum [Safety Notice 2-A].

results.ground_truth: Test alternator charging: Connect voltmeter to battery terminals, start engine and increase RPM to 2000. Voltage should read 13.8-14.4V. Below 13.8V indicates alternator not charging. Above 14.8V indicates regulator failure - turn off engine immediately and disconnect battery [Citation: Para 4-2.2, Table 4-1]. WARNING: Overcharging above 14.8V can cause battery explosion [Safety Notice 4-A].

results.ground_truth: Code P0420 indicates 'Catalyst System Efficiency Below Threshold' - the catalytic converter is not operating at required efficiency [Citation: Para 6-2]. Possible causes: (1) Catalytic converter degradation (most common), (2) Oxygen sensor failure, (3) Exhaust leak before catalyst, (4) Engine running too rich [Citation: Para 6-2]. Verify by monitoring O2 sensor operation - downstream sensor should be steady around 0.45V; if it fluctuates like upstream sensor, converter has failed [Citation: Para 6-2.2].

results.ground_truth: Yes, this is a safety-critical condition. Brake pedal sinking to floor indicates probable master cylinder failure (60% probability) or external fluid leak (30% probability) [Citation: Para 3-2]. Check brake fluid level immediately - low fluid is an emergency condition [Safety Notice 3-B]. If master cylinder failure confirmed, vehicle must be towed - do not attempt to drive as brake failure can occur without warning [Safety Notice 3-C].

results.ground_truth: To test thermostat: Start engine from cold and monitor upper radiator hose temperature. Hose should become hot when temperature gauge reaches 195°F (thermostat opening temperature) [Citation: Table 2-1]. If hose stays cold, thermostat is stuck closed and preventing coolant circulation [Citation: Para 2-2.2].

results.ground_truth: Code P0171 'System Too Lean (Bank 1)' indicates engine running with insufficient fuel or excessive air [Citation: Para 6-3]. Possible causes: (1) Vacuum leak at intake manifold or brake booster hose, (2) Mass airflow sensor contamination, (3) Weak fuel pump or clogged filter, (4) Faulty oxygen sensor, (5) Exhaust leak before O2 sensor [Citation: Para 6-3]. Diagnose by checking for vacuum leaks first (listen for hissing, spray carburetor cleaner around gaskets), then inspect MAF sensor [Citation: Para 6-3.1, Para 6-3.2].

results.ground_truth: Battery warning light illuminated while engine running indicates charging system problem [Citation: Para 4-2]. Probable causes: (1) Alternator drive belt failure - 40% probability, visually inspect belt [Citation: Para 4-2.1]. (2) Alternator failure - 35% probability, test charging voltage at 13.8-14.4V [Citation: Para 4-2.2]. (3) Wiring issue - 15% probability. (4) Voltage regulator failure - 10% probability. results.ground_truth: Oil filter installation: Apply thin film of clean oil to new filter gasket. Thread filter by hand until gasket contacts mounting surface, then tighten additional 3/4 turn. Do not overtighten [Citation: Para 7-2.3]. Hand tighten only - no torque wrench needed [Citation: Table 7-1].

results.ground_truth: Parasitic draw diagnosis [Citation: Para 4-3]: Disconnect negative battery cable and connect ammeter in series between cable and terminal. Close all doors, turn off accessories, wait 20 minutes for modules to sleep [Citation: Para 4-3.1]. Normal draw is 25-50 milliamps [Citation: Table 4-1]. Above 50mA indicates parasitic drain. To locate source, remove fuses one at a time while monitoring ammeter - when amperage drops to normal, faulty circuit is found [Citation: Para 4-3.2].

results.ground_truth: Engine hesitation on acceleration probable causes [Citation: Para 5-3]: (1) Clogged fuel filter - 45% probability, service interval 15,000 miles, often neglected [Citation: Para 5-3.2]. (2) Weak fuel pump - 30% probability, pressure should remain above 35 PSI under load [Citation: Para 5-3.1, Table 5-1]. (3) Dirty fuel injectors - 15% probability. (4) Mass airflow sensor contamination - 10% probability. Most likely: replace fuel filter if over 15,000 miles or unknown [Citation: Para 5-3.2].

per_sample_scores.reference: Code P0420 indicates 'Catalyst System Efficiency Below Threshold' - the catalytic converter is not operating at required efficiency [Citation: Para 6-2]. per_sample_scores.reference: Parasitic draw diagnosis [Citation: Para 4-3]: Disconnect negative battery cable and connect ammeter in series between cable and terminal. Close all doors, turn off accessories, wait 20 minutes for modules to sleep [Citation: Para 4-3.1]. Normal draw is 25-50 milliamps [Citation: Table 4-1]. Above 50mA indicates parasitic drain.
